jx.jx_en_mean: as a second consideration or point

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin secundus 'following, second', from the base of sequi 'follow'. The verb dates from the late 16th cent
late Middle English: from medieval Latin secunda (minuta) 'second (minute'), feminine (used as a noun) of secundus, referring to the ‘second’ operation of dividing an hour by sixty
early 19th cent.: from French en second 'in the second rank (of officers')

encyclopedia.content: 专辑概述 专 辑：Second 歌 手：螺丝钉 语 言：国语专辑1CD 公 司：这里音乐工作室 日 期：2006.03.17专辑简介 在短短的一年内历经千场以上的校园与全台巡回演出 超过百万人见证的现场魅力 螺丝钉 所累积的能量在2006全新专辑《SECOND》中将全部爆发 关于螺丝钉这个乐团，四个成员的音乐启蒙各不相同，有从国小三年级就成为鼓手的嘎嘎；有到了大学才发现音乐里有“乐团”这种东西的小春；也有以为只要成了唱片艺人就会晴空万里的

entry.tran: 秒(a second 或 seconds 往往用以表示很短的时间)
entry.def: A second is one of the sixty parts that a minute is divided into. People often say 'a second' or 'seconds' when they simply mean a very short time.

example.ex: For a few seconds nobody said anything...
example.tran: 有几秒钟大家都沉默无语。

entry.def: The second item in a series is the one that you count as number two.

example.ex: ...the second day of his visit to Delhi.

entry.tran: (用于形容词最高级前)第二…的
entry.def: Second is used before superlative adjectives to indicate that there is only one thing better or larger than the thing you are referring to.

example.ex: The party is still the second strongest in Italy.
example.tran: 该党仍是意大利的第二大党。

example.ex: ...the second-largest city in the United States.

entry.def: You say second when you want to make a second point or give a second reason for something.

example.ex: The soil is depleted first by having crops grown in it and second by natural weathering and bacterial action.
example.tran: 土壤首先是被种植其中的作物消耗掉，其次受自然风化和细菌活动的侵蚀。

entry.tran: 二级甲等/乙等优秀学位
entry.def: In Britain, an upper second is a good honours degree and a lower second is an average honours degree.

example.ex: I then went up to Lancaster University and got an upper second.
example.tran: 后来，我考上了兰开斯特大学，获得了二级甲等学位。

entry.def: If you have seconds, you have a second helping of food.

example.ex: There's seconds if you want them.
example.tran: 如果需要的话可以添菜。

entry.tran: 二级品;二等货;次货;等外品
entry.def: Seconds are goods that are sold cheaply in shops because they have slight faults.

example.ex: It's a new shop selling discounted lines and seconds.
example.tran: 这是家新开的商店，出售打折商品和等外品。

entry.tran: (拳击或国际象棋锦标赛的)副手，助手
entry.def: The seconds of someone who is taking part in a boxing match or chess tournament are the people who assist and encourage them.

example.ex: He shouted to his seconds, 'I did it! I did it!'
example.tran: 他对助手们喊道：“我赢了！我赢了!”

entry.def: If you second a proposal in a meeting or debate, you formally express your agreement with it so that it can then be discussed or voted on.

example.ex: ...Bryan Sutton, who seconded the motion against fox hunting...
example.tran: 赞同反对猎狐动议的布赖恩·萨顿

example.ex: Your application must be proposed and seconded by current members.
example.tran: 你的申请必须由现任成员推荐并得到他们的支持。

entry.def: If you second what someone has said, you say that you agree with them or say the same thing yourself.

example.ex: The Prime Minister seconded the call for discipline in a speech last week.
example.tran: 上周首相在一次演讲中对严肃纪律的号召表示支持。

entry.def: If you experience something at second hand, you are told about it by other people rather than experiencing it yourself.

example.ex: Most of them had only heard of the massacre at second hand.
example.tran: 他们中的大多数人只是听说了那次大屠杀。

entry.tran: 不比任何事物差;首屈一指
entry.def: If you say that something is second to none, you are emphasizing that it is very good indeed or the best that there is.

example.ex: Our scientific research is second to none.
example.tran: 我们的科学研究是顶尖的。

entry.def: If you say that something is second only to something else, you mean that only that thing is better or greater than it.

example.ex: As a major health risk hepatitis is second only to tobacco.
example.tran: 肝炎是仅次于吸烟的主要健康隐患。

collins.item: SENDING SOMEONE TO DO A JOB

entry.def: If you are seconded somewhere, you are sent there temporarily by your employer in order to do special duties.

example.ex: In 1937 he was seconded to the Royal Canadian Air Force in Ottawa as air armament adviser...
example.tran: 1937 年他被临时调往渥太华的加拿大皇家空军担任军备顾问。

example.ex: Several hundred soldiers have been seconded to help farmers.
example.tran: 数百名士兵被临时派去帮助农民。

means.word_mean: 10. merchandise that has imperfections; usually sold at a reduced price without the brand name
1. give support or one's approval to;
2. transfer an employee to a different, temporary assignment;

sentences.sentence: "The officer was seconded for duty overseas"

sequ跟随,追+acious多……的→跟随太多的→盲从的
sequence[[n.先后,次序;连续,数列]]拿省鷄dj.接续而来的
sequent=sequence[n.先后,次序;连续,数列]+ial……的→adj.连续的,一连串的
sub在后面+sequ跟随,追+ent表形容词→随在后面的
con全部+sequence连续→全部连续不断的跟随而来→结果,后果;重要性
second=sequ跟随,追→次等的→第二→秒[分为小时第一等级,秒为二]
sequ跟随,追+ence表名词→跟随→连续
sub在后面+sequ跟随,追+ence表名词→随在后面
